urlText: Bay St, Brighton-Le-Sands, temporary bus stop closures
content:
From 9pm Monday 10 to 5am Tuesday 11, 9pm Tuesday 11 to 6pm Wednesday 12 and 7am Thursday 13 to 6pm Friday 14 January 2022 the following bus stops will be temporarily closed due to M6 Stage 1 work:
  • Bay St opp Aero St (2216142) will be closed. The alternative bus stop will be Bay St at West Botany St (2216143) for route 478 towards Rockdale and route 479 – Rockdale to Kyeemagh (Loop Service). 
  • Bay St after Aero St (2216136) will be closed. Customers can use a temporary bus stop located 120m west of the existing stop, on Bay St between Aero St and Hinkler St, for route 478 towards Miranda via Ramsgate and 479 – Rockdale to Kyeemagh (Loop Service).
subtitle: Bay St, Brighton-Le-Sands, temporary bus stop closures

urlText: Circular Quay diversions for New Year’s Eve
content:
From 5pm until 7pm on 31 December, buses that usually run to and from Circular Quay will be relocated to stops on Elizabeth St at Martin Place due to road closures in place for New Year’s Eve.
 
Check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
From 7pm all buses will be relocated to temporary terminals at Hyde Park, Town Hall and Wynyard.
 
For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page. 
 
Stops affected:
  • Circular Quay, Young St, Stand D Sydney (200065)
  • Circular Quay, Alfred St, Stand B Sydney (20002)
  • Circular Quay, Alfred St, Stand A Sydney (2000147)
  • Chifley Square, Phillip St Sydney (2000415)
  • Museum of Sydney, Phillip St Sydney (200059)
  • Phillip St opp Museum of Sydney Sydney (200068)
subtitle: Circular Quay diversions for New Year’s Eve

urlText: Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern
content:
Saturday 22 and Sunday 23 January
  • Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern.
  • Revesby trains run between Revesby and Central, platform 23, via the Airport.
  • Most Macarthur trains towards the City run to the City Circle via Sydenham. If you are travelling to Airport stations please change trains at Revesby.
  • Trains from the City Circle run to Macarthur via the Airport. 
  • Some morning and evening Macarthur trains start and end at Central, platform 23, and run via the Airport.
  • City Circle trains run in one direction only, from Central first stop Town Hall.
subtitle: Trains run to a changed timetable and stopping pattern

Trains from the City Circle run to Macarthur via the Airport.

urlText: Trackwork between Lithgow and Penrith
content:

  • Nightly from 7.30pm until 4am, buses replace trains from Lithgow to Penrith.
  • The last train from the Blue Mountains leaves Mount Victoria at 19:01, arriving Central at 21:23.
  • Nightly from 9.10pm until 3.30am, buses replace trains from Penrith to Lithgow.
  • The last train to the Blue Mountains leaves Central at 19:18, arriving Mount Victoria at 21:36.
  • Trains run to the normal timetable between Penrith and Central.

urlText: Trackwork may affect your travel
content:
Saturday 8 and Sunday 9 January
  • Buses replace trains between Port Kembla and Wollongong, and between Thirroul and Sutherland.
  • Express buses also run between Wollongong, North Wollongong and Sutherland for customers travelling between South Coast and T4 Illawarra Line stations.
  • South Coast Line trains run between Kiama and Thirroul. T4 Illawarra Line trains run between Sutherland and Bondi Junction, some to a changed timetable.

  • From 8pm Saturday until 8am Sunday, buses replace trains between Thirroul and Hurstville, with extra buses running between Wollongong, North Wollongong and Hurstville.
  • Trains run between Kiama and Thirroul, and between Hurstville and Bondi Junction.
Bus routes
27SC: Port Kembla, then all stations to Wollongong and return
48SC: Helensburgh Station, Helensburgh (township) then Otford Station and return
90SC: Wollongong, North Wollongong, then express to Sutherland and return
66SC: Thirroul, then Heathcote, Engadine, Loftus, Sutherland and return
67SC: Thirroul, then all stations to Sutherland and return
 
From 8pm Saturday until 8am Sunday
68SC: Thirroul, then Heathcote, Engadine, Loftus, Sutherland, Hurstville and return
69SC: Thirroul, then all stations to Sutherland, Hurstville and return
87SC: Wollongong, North Wollongong, then express to Sutherland then Hurstville and return

urlText: Station Update - Sydenham
content: Platforms 4, 5 & 6 upgrade works. A new Metro concourse is being constructed on the northern end of Sydenham Station. While the concourse is being installed, please use the first 5 carriages of the train on platforms 4 & 6 and the last 6 carriages of the train on platform 5. If you need help, please ask staff at the station. For more information on these upgrades, please see sydneymetro.info

urlText: L2 Randwick and L3 Kingsford partial line closure for New Year’s Eve
content:
• From 5pm Friday 31 December, L2 and L3 Line light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall while roads are closed for New Year’s Eve celebrations.
  • Use alternative transport including walking between Circular Quay and Town Hall.
  • L2 and L3 light rail services will continue running between Town Hall and Randwick or Juniors Kingsford throughout the night until 4am.
  • Due to light rail vehicle repairs, buses are replacing all light rail services on the L1 Dulwich Hill Line between Central and Dulwich Hill stations until further notice.
  • Full L2 and L3 light rail services will resume as per normal schedule from 5am Saturday 1 January (New Year’s Day).
  • For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.
subtitle: L2 Randwick and L3 Kingsford partial line closure for New Year’s Eve

properties.smsText: L2 Randwick and L3 Kingsford partial line closure for New Year’s Eve
properties.speechText:
From 5pm Friday 31 December, L2 and L3 Line light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall while roads are closed for New Year’s Eve celebrations.
Use alternative transport including walking between Circular Quay and Town Hall.
L2 and L3 light rail services will continue running between Town Hall and Randwick or Juniors Kingsford throughout the night until 4am.
Due to light rail vehicle repairs, buses are replacing all light rail services on the L1 Dulwich Hill Line between Central and Dulwich Hill stations until further notice.
Full L2 and L3 light rail services will resume as per normal schedule from 5am Saturday 1 January (New Year’s Day).

urlText: Central Station: Access changes and upgrade works
content:
From 10pm Saturday 25 December to 4am Friday 31 December 2021 the escalators and lifts between the Grand Concourse and Northern Concourse at Central Station will be closed for Sydney Metro construction works.

Alternative stairs, escalators and lift are available outside the Opal gates.

Please follow the signs and staff directions.

If you need assistance, see station staff.

 

From 21 November 2021 to March 2022, the north escalator from the concourse to Platforms 24 and 25 (Town Hall end) will be closed for maintenance works.

To access platforms 24 and 25 travel down the concourse to the lift or use the south escalator to Platforms 24 and 25 (Redfern end).

If you need assistance, see station staff.
 

Platforms 16-23
Platform re-levelling and re-tiling works are being undertaken during rail shutdown weekends.

There will be changes to the floor surface in different areas of each platform, and there will be temporary concrete ramps that connect differences in floor levels.

Hoarding will also be adjusted on each platform to facilitate the progression of Sydney Metro construction works.

For your safety, please move carefully along the platform and follow directions from staff.

Change to boarding assistance location
Platform 16, 17
If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight, please board via the front door of the fifth train carriage.

Platform 18, 19
If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight, please board via the rear door of the fourth train carriage.

Platform 20, 21
If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight, please board via the front door of the fifth train carriage.

Platform 22, 23
If you are travelling to Central Station and require assistance to alight, please board via the rear door of the fourth train carriage.

Stair, escalator and lifts upgrade works from 11 January to end-December 2021
The escalators and staircase connecting the corner of Pitt Street and Eddy Avenue with the Grand Concourse and L1 light rail stop will be closed due to station upgrade works.

To access the Grand Concourse and Platforms 1 – 12 from the street level, please use the Western Forecourt entry via Pitt Street. To access Platforms 16 – 25 from the street level, please use the Eddy Avenue entry.

To access Pitt Street or Eddy Avenue from the Grand Concourse or L1 light rail stop, please exit the station via the Western Forecourt or Northern Concourse.

You can view a map of the station here.
subtitle: Central Station: Access changes and upgrade works

urlText: Buses replace light rail services on the L1 Line
content:
Buses replace all light rail services until further notice on the L1 Dulwich Hill Line between Central Grand Concourse and Dulwich Hill, due to light rail vehicle repairs.
 
From Monday 29 November, the following replacement bus routes will be operating:
  • Route 2L1 Central to The Star and return
  • Route 3L1 Lilyfield to Central via Glebe, The Star
  • Route 4L1 Dulwich Hill to The Star via Anzac Bridge and return
There will be an additional ferry service, F10 between Blackwattle Bay Wharf, Glebe and Barangaroo Wharf.
 
Please note:
  • A 50 percent discounted fare applies on board light rail replacement bus services.
  • The F10 service will only accept payments made with credit or debit cards, with full adult ferry fares charged.
  • All light rail replacement buses at Central Station depart from the Western Forecourt (adjacent to the Grand Concourse).
  • If you are travelling between Central Station and Darling Harbour, walking might be an alternative transport option.
  • L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line will continue to run as per normal schedule.
See here for further information on service frequency, recommended capacity and stop locations.
 
Allow extra travel time and use the Trip Planner or check travel alerts to see if you travel is affected, or to find alternative transport options.
subtitle: Buses replace light rail services on the L1 Line

urlText: McMahons Point service changes for New Year’s Eve
content:
Buses will not operate to and from McMahons Point on New Year’s Eve due to road closures from 6pm the night before on 30 December. Buses will start from Blue St North Sydney Station and end at Miller St North Sydney until 3pm, after this time buses will relocate to stops on Miller St and Pacific Hwy. Catch trains to Milsons Point instead.
 
For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.

Trains run to a changed timetable between Leppington and the City via Granville, every 30 minutes and do not stop at Ashfield. Express trains continue to stop at Burwood.
T1 Western Line Penrith trains make extra stops at Flemington and Homebush.
Bus routes
47T2: Strathfield, all stations to Central and return
48T2: Strathfield, all stations to Summer Hill, then Newtown, Macdonaldtown, then Central and return
50T2: Lewisham, Petersham, Stanmore, then express to Central and return

urlText: Service changes for New Year’s Eve events
content:
Sydney Metro services will run frequently on New Year’s Eve with services running every 5 mins from 4pm until approximately 2am, then every 10 minutes throughout New Year's Day.
 
If you’re travelling to the Sydney CBD vantange points change at Epping for trains to the city
 
If you’re travelling to the North Shore vantage points change at Chatswood for trains to North Sydney.
 
For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.
subtitle: Service changes for New Year’s Eve events

properties.smsText: Service changes for New Year’s Eve events
properties.speechText:
Sydney Metro services will run frequently on New Year’s Eve with services running every 5 mins from 6pm until 3am.
 
If you’re travelling to the Sydney CBD change at Epping for trains to the city
 
If you’re travelling to the North Shore vantage points change at Chatswood for trains to North Sydney.
 
For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.

urlText: Services changes for New Year’s Eve
content:
From 7pm on New Year’s Eve until 4am on New Year’s Day buses in the Sydney CBD will be using different routes and temporary stops due to major road closures in place for NYE celebrations in the city.
 
All buses to and from the city will use temporary bus interchanges from 7pm to 4am at the following locations (see our getting home map for more details):
  • Hyde Park Interchange – Terminal 1 on Elizabeth St near Market St for services towards the Inner West and South. Terminal 2 on Park St at Hyde Park for services towards the South Eastern Suburbs. Terminal 3 on College St at St Marys Cathedral for services towards the Eastern Suburbs
  • Town Hall Interchange – Terminal 4 on York St QVB for services towards the Northern and north western suburbs and Terminal 5 on Park St Town Hall at Pitt St for services towards Zetland, Gore Hill, Bondi Junction, Pyrmont, Drummoyne, Cabarita, Chiswick.
  • Wynyard Interchange - Terminal 6 on York St at Wynyard Park for services to the Lower North Shore and Northern Suburbs. Terminal 7 on Carrington St at Wynyard Park for services to the Northern Beaches. Terminal 8 on Clarence St at Erskine St and Margaret St for services to the Hills District, St Ives, Belrose and Davidson.
Note from 11pm to 1.30am buses will terminate either side of the Sydney Harbour Bridge while it is closed during the midnight fireworks. Catch a train across the Harbour Bridge to connect with buses from North Sydney and continue your trip.
 
Check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations. For more details on additional transport services and changes including maps,visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.
subtitle: Services changes for New Year’s Eve

properties.smsText: Services changes for New Year’s Eve
properties.speechText:
·       Hyde Park Interchange – Terminal 1 on Elizabeth St near Market St for services towards the Inner West and South. Terminal 2 on Park St at Hyde Park for services towards the South Eastern Suburbs. Terminal 3 on College St at St Marys Cathedral for services towards the Eastern Suburbs

·       Town Hall Interchange – Terminal 4 on York St QVB for services towards the Northern and north western suburbs and Terminal 5 on Park St Town Hall at Pitt St for services towards Zetland, Gore Hill, Bondi Junction, Pyrmont, Drummoyne, Cabarita, Chiswick.

·       Wynyard Interchange - Terminal 6 on York St at Wynyard Park for services to the Lower North Shore and Northern Suburbs. Terminal 7 on Carrington St at Wynyard Park for services to the Northern Beaches. Terminal 8 on Clarence St at Erskine St and Margaret St for services to the Hills District, St Ives, Belrose and Davidson.

 

Note from 11pm to 1.30am buses will terminate either side of the Sydney Harbour Bridge while it is closed during the midnight fireworks. Catch a train across the Harbour Bridge to connect with buses from North Sydney and continue your trip.

 

Check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations. For more details on additional transport services and changes including maps, 
 
For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.

urlText: Trackwork may affect your travel
content:
Sunday 26 to Friday 31 December
  • Homebush trains run between Liverpool and the City via Regents Park, stopping at all stations between Liverpool and Lidcombe, then running to the normal timetable between Homebush and the City.
  • Extra limited-stop trains run between Ashfield and the City, continuing to Kingsgrove via the Airport. 
  • On Monday and Tuesday, daily from 4.40am until 7am, buses replace the all-stations Homebush trains from Central to Ashfield, in that direction only.
  • On Tuesday from 11.50pm until 1.30am, Homebush trains run between Homebush and the City only.
  • On Wednesday from 10.50pm until 1.30am, buses replace the all-stations Homebush trains between Strathfield and Ashfield.
  • Leppington trains continue to run but will not stop at Ashfield. Change at Strathfield to continue your journey.
  • T1 Western Line trains make an extra stop at Homebush.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information.
Bus routes
Monday and Tuesday morning – one direction only
45T2: Central, then Macdonaldtown, Newtown, express to Summer Hill, then Ashfield
46T2: Central, then all stations to Ashfield
50T2: Central, express to Stanmore, Petersham, then Lewisham
 
Wednesday night
43T2: Strathfield, then all Stations to Ashfield and return
subtitle: Trackwork may affect your travel

urlText: Yagoona Station upgrade works
content:
Upgrade works are in progress at Yagoona Station and trains will not be running between Sunday 26 December and Sunday 9 January.
 
The existing concourse has been partially demolished and temporary hoarding installed, temporary handrails have been installed at stair level to allow customers to walk down the stairs.
 
For your safety, please follow pedestrian controllers instruction and avoid standing near the hoarded areas and move towards the stairs down to the platforms.
 
Please follow the signs and see Station Staff between 6am – 7pm Monday to Friday and 8am – 4pm Saturday & Sunday if you need assistance.
subtitle: Yagoona Station upgrade works

properties.smsText: Yagoona Station upgrade works
properties.speechText: Upgrade works are in progress at Yagoona Station and trains will not be running between Sunday 26 December and Sunday 9 January. The existing concourse has been partially demolished and temporary hoarding installed, temporary handrails have been installed at stair level to allow customers to walk down the stairs. For your safety, please follow pedestrian controllers instruction and avoid standing near the hoarded areas and move towards the stairs down to the platforms. Please follow the signs and see Station Staff between 6.00am – 7.00pm Monday to Friday and 8.00am – 4.00pm Saturday & Sunday if you need assistance.

urlText: Circular Quay service changes for New Year’s Eve
content:
Trains will not drop off customers at Circular Quay station from 5pm until midnight on New Year’s Eve to manage crowds at surrounding harbour vantage points.  
 
The nearest available stations are Wynyard, Martin Place and St James which are all within walking distance of the harbour.
 
Remember, access to most NYE vantage points in the city are for ticketholders only.
 
For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.

There are changes on route 632 train services due to insufficient staff. 
Replaced by road coach for the entire journey.
 Plan ahead and allow extra travel time.

urlText: Trackwork may affect your travel
content:
Saturday 1 to Monday 3 January
  • Homebush trains run between Liverpool and the City via Regents Park, stopping at all stations between Liverpool and Lidcombe, then running to the normal timetable between Homebush and the City.

  • Saturday from 6.30am until 10.30am, Homebush trains run between Ashfield and the City only.
  • Leppington trains make extra stops at Homebush and Croydon.

  • From 11pm Saturday until 5am Sunday, trains run to a changed timetable between Leppington and Ashfield only, making extra stops at Homebush and Croydon. Buses replace all trains between Ashfield and Central.
  • If you are travelling to the City change at Strathfield for express buses to Central.
  • Express buses leave from Strathfield, and all-stations buses leave from Ashfield.
  • Plan your trip before you travel for up-to-date real time information.
Bus routes
Saturday night / Sunday morning
40T2: Strathfield, then express to Central and return
47T2: Strathfield, all stations to Central and return
48T2: Strathfield, all stations to Summer Hill, then Newtown, Macdonaldtown, then Central and return
50T2: Lewisham, Petersham, Stanmore, then express to Central and return
subtitle: Trackwork may affect your travel

urlText: Buses replace trains between Blacktown and Olympic Park
content:

urlText: Station Update - Central
content: There are changes happening at Central Station due to Sydney Metro construction works. Access to certain areas of the station and platforms may mean using different stairs, escalators and lifts. Please follow the signs and staff directions. If you need assistance, see station staff. For detailed information please visit https://transportnsw.info/alerts/details#/6063489

urlText: Milsons Point service changes for New Year’s Eve
content:
Trains from the city will not stop at Milsons Point from 6pm until midnight on New Year’s Eve to manage crowds at surrounding vantage points. Catch trains to North Sydney station instead and continue on foot for access to Milsons Point and Kirribilli vantage points.
 
Capacity is limited at Milsons Point and Kirribilli vantage points, and are expected to fill early so arrive early or have a backup plan in mind.
 
For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.
subtitle: Milsons Point service changes for New Year’s Eve

urlText: North Sydney bus services changes for New Year’s Eve
content:
From 3pm on New Year’s Eve until 3am on New Year’s Day buses to and from North Sydney will use temporary terminals and stops due to closures around the station on Blue St.
 
Lower North Shore and Hills District buses will leave from stops on Miller St and Pacific Hwy (see our interchange map for more details):
  • Terminal 1 - Pacific Hwy near Australia Post Office at William St: Routes 252, 254, 261, 265, 290, 291, and from 5pm 286 and 287.
  • Terminal 2 - Miller St at Northpoint near Berry St: Routes 144n, 150x, 154x, 228, 229, 230, 263 and after 11pm Routes 100, 172x, 173x, 230
  • Terminal 3 - Miller St at Monte Sant’ Angelo College: from 5pm 202, 203, 207, 208, 209 and 260
    Pacific Hwy at Berry St: Routes 320, 602x, 612x, 622
  • Berry St after Miller St: from 11pm to 1.30am only B-Line buses towards Mona Vale will leave from Berry St while the Harbour Bridge is closed. 

Note from 11pm to 1.30am buses will terminate either side of the Sydney Harbour Bridge while it is closed during the midnight fireworks. Catch a train across the Harbour Bridge to connect with buses and continue your trip.
 
Check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations. For more details on additional transport services and changes including maps, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.
subtitle: North Sydney bus services changes for New Year’s Eve

urlText: Henry Lawson Reserve, Blues Point, temporary bus stop closure
content:
From 5am Monday 1 November to 5am Wednesday 30 March 2022, Sydney Metro work at Blues Point will result in the temporary closure of bus stop Henry Lawson Reserve (206037) and affect the 254 route towards Riverview and the 291 route towards Epping.

urlText: McMahons Point service changes for New Year’s Eve

Capacity is limited at Blues Point and surrounding vantage points, and are expected to fill early so arrive early or have a backup plan in mind.

For more details on ferry service changes and other transport options, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.

urlText: Walsh Bay and Millers Point diversions for New Year’s Eve
content:
From 12pm until 7pm on 31 December, buses that usually run to and from Walsh Bay will start and end their trips at QVB Town Hall due to road closures on Hickson Rd for New Year’s Eve. Buses will not run between Town Hall and Millers Point / Walsh Bay.
 
Services will pick up from York St QVB Stand A and drop off at Park St Town Hall Stand J. Check signs at bus stops for alternative stop locations.
 
From 7pm all buses will be relocated to temporary terminals at Hyde Park, QVB Town Hall and Wynyard.
 
For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.

urlText: L1 Dulwich Hill Line replacement bus service changes in Pyrmont and Central for New Year’s Eve
content:
Due to road closures in Pyrmont and Central on Friday 31 December for New Year’s Eve celebrations, routes 2L1, 3L1 and 4L1 replacement bus services will be using different routes and stops:
  • From 6pm – 4am 2L1 and 3L1 light rail replacement buses will not stop at Central Grand Concourse. Catch buses from the alternative temporary stop on Hay St before Pitt St at Belmore Park (towards The Star or Lilyfield). Buses to the city will drop off on Pitt St near Central.
  • From 7pm – 4am 3L1 and 4L1 light rail replacement buses will not stop at John St Square and Fish Market. Services will use alternative temporary stops on Pyrmont Bridge Rd instead. All L1 replacement bus services will be extended until 4am Saturday 1 January (New Year’s Day).
L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall after 5pm on New Year’s Eve. Services run regularly between Town Hall, Randwick or Juniors Kingsford until 4am New Year’s Day.
 
Route 2L1, 3L1 and 4L1 replacement buses will return to regular routes and stops from 6am Saturday 1 January.
 
For more details on additional transport services and changes, visit the Sydney NYE event page.
subtitle: L1 Dulwich Hill Line replacement bus service changes in Pyrmont and Central for New Year’s Eve

properties.smsText: L1 Dulwich Hill Line replacement bus service changes in Pyrmont and Central for New Year’s Eve
properties.speechText:
Due to road closures in Pyrmont and Central on Friday 31 December for New Year’s Eve celebrations, routes 2L1, 3L1 and 4L1 replacement bus services will be using different routes and stops:
From 6pm – 4am 2L1 and 3L1 light rail replacement buses will not stop at Central Grand Concourse. Catch buses from the alternative temporary stop on Hay St before Pitt St at Belmore Park (towards The Star or Lilyfield). Buses to the city will drop off on Pitt St near Central.
From 7pm – 4am 3L1 and 4L1 light rail replacement buses will not stop at John St Square and Fish Market. Services will use alternative temporary stops on Pyrmont Bridge Rd instead. 4L1 replacement bus services will be extended until 4am Saturday 1 January (New Year’s Day).
L2 Randwick Line and L3 Kingsford Line light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall after 5pm on New Year’s Eve. Services run regularly between Town Hall, Randwick or Juniors Kingsford until 4am New Year’s Day.
 
Route 2L1, 3L1 and 4L1 replacement buses will return to regular routes and stops from 6am Saturday 1 January.

urlText: Watsons Bay bus changes for New Year’s Eve
content:
Due to road closures for New Years’ Eve from 5pm until 2am services towards the City will be diverting via Fitzwilliam Rd, Wentworth Rd and Hopetoun Ave, missing stops on Vaucluse Rd. Services from the city to Watsons Bay will run as normal but may experience delays.
 
For more details on transport service changes on New Year’s Eve, visit the NYE 2021 event page.

urlText: City Circle trackwork may affect your travel
content:
Monday 17 to Thursday 20 January
  • Nightly from 9.45pm until 1.30am, buses replace trains between Central and Circular Quay via Museum.
  • T2 Leppington, T3 Bankstown and T8 Airport & South Line trains start and end at Central.
  • T1 Western, T2 Inner West and T9 Northern Line trains continue to run between Central and Wynyard.
  • If you are travelling between Central, Town Hall, Wynyard and Circular Quay you can catch the light rail.
Bus route
 
5CC: Central, Museum, St James, Circular Quay and return
subtitle: City Circle trackwork may affect your travel

urlText: The Crescent, Annandale temporary bus stop closure
content:
The westbound bus stop on The Crescent at Johnston St (203816) will be closed from Monday 16 November 2020 until January 2023 for WestConnex Rozelle Interchange works.

Route 433 services towards Balmain Gladstone Park and Major Event Bus route 2 towards Sydney Olympic Park will use the stop on The Crescent at View St (203815) instead.

Check signs for directions to the alternative stop location.

urlText: Service changes for New Year’s Eve
content:
Ferries will be affected on New Year’s Eve with exclusion zones in effect for the 9pm and midnight fireworks.
 
From some wharves, the last ferries to the city leave from mid-afternoon. After the midnight fireworks limited ferries will run on select routes.
 
Long queues are expected at wharves on New Year’s Eve so plan ahead and have an alternative transport option in mind. Extra trains and buses will run regularly to and from the city throughout the night.
 
For more details on ferry service changes and other transport options, visit the Sydney New Year’s Eve event page.
subtitle: Service changes for New Year’s Eve
